rows.title: The Company
rows.titleText: Hey there, just died? Don't worry, we'll get you sorted out in time for your first contract.

objects.title: New Hire
objects.text:
"I died? Contract? What are you talking about?"

[Make a brand new character]

objects.title: Contractor
objects.text:
"Actually, I'm already a contractor, just looking to switch out my armaments."

[Opens Infernal Armaments and Sub-Contracts section only]

rows.title: New Hire
rows.titleText: Yikes, the Styx took more of your memories than I thought, let's take it slow. First off, you're dead. Sorry for your loss, but seeing as you're here in hell, maybe not. More importantly, you agreed to become a contractor for the Rivers Company. Which means You've agreed to complete seven contracts in exchange for a second chance. Now, before you can be assigned a contract, we'll have to confirm a few details.

objects.title: Sure, Let's Do This
objects.text:
"Right, I remember now. Let's get this show on the road."

[Go straight to character creation]

objects.title: Wait Hold On ...
objects.text: "Just hold on a second, this is a lot. I need some additional lore before anything else."

rows.title: Lore
rows.titleText: Sure thing. What did you want to know about?

objects.title: The Company
objects.text: We are the Rivers Contracting Company, an affiliate of the Styx Rivers Company. Based right here in hell, we contract recently deceased mortals such as yourself who aren't ready for it to all end just yet. With your unique status as "not-quite-a-fiend" but "not-quite-a-mortal", you're able to perform tasks that our fiendish employees are not able to. We offer your services to our various clients and in turn, you are given a second chance.

objects.title: Seven Contracts
objects.text: The standard terms and conditions offered to all new hires. In exchange for completing seven contracts through the company, you will be given a second chance. These contracts are selected by our president and offered to you and other contractors like yourself to be completed in small teams. These contracts could vary from apprehending criminals who've escaped beyond the usual jurisdiction of of the Nine Hells, retrieving materials requested by our valued clients, so on and so forth - just about anything really.

objects.title: Hell
objects.text: Yup, hell! The Nine Hells of Baator to be precise. New arrivals wash in on the River Styx that wipes your memories from when you were alive, but luckily for you, our boatman fished you out before you fully lost yourself and became a lemure - nasty little pile of loathing and sorrow. If you'd prefer that though, we can always put you back.

objects.title: Second Chance
objects.text: Yes indeed! Our company has been given special allowance by the powers-that-be to alter the fate of a select few individuals of our choosing. When you've successfully completed seven contracts, you'll be given an opportunity to be returned to life - among other choices. No need to get too complicated yet.

rows.title: Race
rows.titleText: If you need to double check, there's a mirror over there.

objects.title: Human
objects.text: Human is it? Work hard if you want to stand out, good luck.

objects.title: Half Elf
objects.text: All that time and you still ended up in hell huh? Shame, shame.

objects.title: Elf
objects.text: Oh boy, how'd you end up here? Were you already separate from the hivemind or are you going to need some therapy?

objects.title: Dwarf
objects.text: Hail dwarf, one of our executives wants all kin coming through to know "honor is all". Said any true dwarf would know what that means.

objects.title: Dragonborn
objects.text: Dragonborn huh? Keep your head low westward and you'll be fine.

objects.title: Half Orc
objects.text: Are you from the empire or the plains? Is the empire still around? What do you mean what empire?

objects.title: Tiefling
objects.text: You're not a Hellborn are you? It'll be awfully awkward if you're a native that just happened to fall into the Styx.

objects.title: Halfling
objects.text: Are you one of the cannibal ones? Oh, we're take you regardless - but it'll be good to know if we need to allocate manflesh for you in the cafeteria.

objects.title: Gnome
objects.text: You wouldn't happen to be a Fnipper would you? One of our executives wants to know if any of his clan ends up here.

objects.title: Goblin
objects.text: A goblin? In hell? That's pretty unique. A bit of a deviant aren't you?

objects.title: Kobold
objects.text: Kobold are you? Don't go too far west and you should be fine.

objects.title: Goliath
objects.text: Goliath is it? Tough luck with the temperature down here, I'm rooting for ya!

objects.title: Genasi
objects.text: Not your first time off the mortal plane then? Hopefully this won't be too jarring then.

objects.title: Changeling
objects.text: One of our executives is a changeling too. We have high expectations for your talents.

objects.title: Other
objects.text: A what? Huh. That might be a new one for us, which is pretty impressive. Where'd you say you're from again? [Check with DM if you wish to play a race not listed here]

rows.title: Appearance
rows.titleText: Great! Now if you'd take a look in that mirror over there ...

objects.title: I am ...
objects.text: [Click here to upload an image for your character!]

rows.title: Background
rows.titleText: Who were you before you died? What did you do?

objects.title: No One Special
objects.text: Just a mundane life is it? I find that hard to believe, but keep your secrets if you must. [Choose a PHB background, you gain its non-material benefits]

objects.title: I Don't Remember
objects.text: Can't remember anything? Unfortunate, looks like we fished you out of the Styx a little too late. I'll see if I can allocate you a little more company resources to compensate for your lack of ... life experiences. [You gain an additional Infernal Armament]

objects.title: It Doesn't Matter
objects.text: It doesn't? Oh I see ... you've taken to your new circumstances quite well haven't you? You're looking like one of us already. Well, don't go turning into a devil yet - you can only fulfill your contract while you're still partially mortal. [You gain an additional Diabolic Boon]

rows.title: What's Your Damage?
rows.titleText:
Surely you've had some trials and tribulations in your final moments, would you like to talk about it? 
Having a reason to reach for that second chance at life might help you stay human in the meantime.

objects.title: I'm Not Telling
objects.text: Well fine, keep your secrets then. As long as you know what motivates you forward, that'll be enough.

objects.title: Burned Alive
objects.text: They say burning alive is one of the most painful ways to die, that you don't realize the pain from the searing flames is only the beginning. Our condolences - do you happen to remember who was responsible?

objects.title: Drowned
objects.text: Lost at sea in a storm? Or something more malevolent? There's a belief that it's a calm way to go but it really isn't.

objects.title: Lab Rat
objects.text: In a lab you say? As a volunteer or ...? Horrifying. Did you happen to get the name of the one in charge?

objects.title: Dishonored
objects.text: Dishonored? Like you couldn't live with yourself after you couldn't fulfill some duty? Well if nothing else, that kind of loyalty and determination is something we appreciate.

objects.title: An Impossible Foe
objects.text: A hunter who became the hunted are you? At least it was on your terms - even if it was unexpected. Did you at least catch a glimpse of what it was?

objects.title: Enslaved
objects.text: A slave to the end then? Tragic. You'll be happy to know that we're nothing like that - our employment contract has been rated in the Erebus 500 for centuries.

objects.title: Framed
objects.text: You didn't do it? Huh, well that's unfortunate. Why? Well, you'd have a lot more clout down here if you did.

objects.title: Overwhelmed
objects.text: "It was supposed to be a simple job," kind of situation? Four out of five it was a tragic mistake, but just in case, did you happen to have any enemies who'd want you dead?

objects.title: Exterminated
objects.text: Fought to the end but it was not enough. This creature that hunted you and everyone you know down, what did you say it was again?

objects.title: Sacrificed
objects.text: Cultists, what a troublesome bunch. They didn't happen to leave any marks on you did they? We could identify whose responsible for you.

objects.title: Betrayed
objects.text: By your most trusted comrades too? That's painful. And that whole setup for you to take the fall ... they must've been planning it for a long time.

rows.title: Class
rows.titleText: What do I mean by class? Oh boy, here we go.

rows.title: Contractor Benefits
rows.titleText:
Ah, and here's the fun stuff. 
Here at the Rivers Contracting Company, we offer our valuable contractors a variety of benefits to help you carry out your contracts.

objects.title: Diabolic Boons
objects.text: As a new contractor, you are allocated a maximum of two Diabolic Boons - imbuements of fiendish power to your soul that'll grant you spectacular abilities. These imbuements are permanent. Side effects you ask? Nothing serious - only cosmetics. Though if you take too many, it might make it difficult for you to stay undercover. After all, if you look like a devil and walk like a devil ...

objects.title: A Bit of Both
objects.text: Can't decide? A little bit of both is easy enough to do.

objects.title: Infernal Armaments
objects.text: As a new contractor, you are allocated a maximum of two Infernal Armament points to equip yourself with specialized tools from our infernal armory that you can bring out on your contracts. You can switch out these armaments between your contracts.

rows.title: Diabolic Boons
rows.titleText: You are something in-between. Not alive nor dead, not mortal nor fiend. Your soul and body are malleable, and with the power at our disposal, we can mold you in both form and spirit to be more suited for your tasks. Do be aware that these changes will be permanent, which might prove a little problematic if you're hoping to return to a normal life afterwards.

objects.title: Devil's Sight
objects.text: You can see in the dark out to a distance of 120 feet. This vision pierces through magical darkness as well as mundane, rendering even pitch darkness as shades of gray. Cannot be taken with Sage's Sight.

addons.title: Ominous Glow
addons.text: Your eyes give off a fiendish glow in the dark - just like a cat.

objects.title: Sage's Sight
objects.text: Created by the Archdevil Levistus to mimic the legendary argent eyes that lets one see the strands of the weave that form all magics. Whether you want to or not, you are able to see where and when magic is cast - identifying them effortlessly. Cannot be taken with Devil's Sight.

addons.title: Avert Thine Eyes
addons.text: Divine magic is blindingly bright to you, to a point where watching such a spell being cast is physically painful.

objects.title: Retractable Claws
objects.text: Your nails become deadly black claws that can extend and retract at will. They are deadly natural weapon capable of ripping through flesh, stone, and steel, and grant you the ability to effortlessly climb and cling to any surface.

addons.title: Killer Manicure
addons.text: Even fully retracted, your nails will be sharp, black, and no less than an inch long.

objects.title: Lifestealer Fangs
objects.text: Your teeth become nigh unbreakable and your canines extend and sharpen. When you bite a living creature, you can rapidly drain their lifeforce - rapidly recovering your own injuries.

addons.title: Sharp Smile
addons.text: Your fiendish whites don't fit perfectly in your mortal maw, and is nearly impossible to hide when you speak or smile.

objects.title: Shadow Visage
objects.text: When in darkness or dim light, you can wield the shadows around you to cast Invisibility or Disguise Self on yourself at-will. The effect ends when you enter bright light.

addons.title: Spooky Shadows
addons.text: Your shadow behaves erratically, sometimes its too short, sometimes its too long. Sometimes it smiles when it thinks no one is watching.

objects.title: Shadow Devil
objects.text: Your shadow comes to life and is capable of acting independently as a life-devouring shade. While attached to you, it is indistinguishable from your regular spooky shadow - but you can have it detach and act according to your orders. If it is destroyed, it reforms after a long rest.

addons.title: Nowhere to be Found
addons.text: While your shadow is detached from you, you do not cast a shadow.

objects.title: Prehensile Tail
objects.text: You grow a tail up to 5 feet long. If you're a race that naturally has a tail, it can be up to 10 feet long. It is precise and dexterous, functioning as an additional limb capable of holding weapons, manipulating objects, or just scratching your back.

addons.title: Restless Tail Syndrome
addons.text: Like an evil puppy, your fiendish backside companion can't help but sway side-to-side when there's carnage to be reckoned.

objects.title: Pale Exoskeleton
objects.text: Your flesh hardens like bone, yet remains flexible. You gain resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered.

addons.title: Searing Silver
addons.text: Silver becomes your enemy, its presence gives you an uncomfortable itch and contact with it on your bare skin is painful.

objects.title: Canian Blood
objects.text: Your blood runs cold and light - floating away before rapidly evaporating when exposed to open air. You gain immunity to cold damage. You gain resistance to fire and poison damage. You cannot be poisoned.

addons.title: Cold Steam
addons.text: Your natural body temperature sits just above freezing and if made to bleed - your blood floats and evaporates rapidly.

objects.title: Misting Blood
objects.text: Your blood evaporates almost immediately when exposed to open air. You can cast Misty Step at-will and Mislead once per short rest.

addons.title: Scent on the Wind
addons.text: While you leave no tangible evidence, the slightest hint of your blood in the air is like a beacon for creatures with a keen sense of smell to track you down.

objects.title: Enflamed Blood
objects.text: Your blood runs hot and dark - a bubbling ichor. You gain immunity to fire damage. You gain resistance to cold and poison damage. You cannot be poisoned.

addons.title: Running Hot
addons.text: Your natural body temperature runs high and if made to bleed - your blood flows unnaturally slow and thick.

objects.title: Erupting Blood
objects.text: Your blood ignites violently and can be wielded to unleash gouts of hellfire. You can cast Hellish Rebuke at-will and Fireball once per short rest.

addons.title: Burning Bright
addons.text: When you take significant damage and are made to bleed - there is a chance you will spontaneously combust. While you may shrug off the flames - your surroundings often cannot.

objects.title: Dark Worship
objects.text: Your scent and presence can fool even a veteran paladin. So long as you're not using another Diabolic Boon or Infernal Armament directly - you give off the presence of a cleric of a "good" god.

addons.title: One of Them
addons.text: You will have to choose which of the "good" gods or saints you follow, and keep your guard up around their true followers for they'll surely be able to tell something is wrong.

objects.title: Devilish Tongue
objects.text: Your words are laced with subtle charms that twist the will of others - highly effective against creatures not outright hostile to you.

addons.title: Snake Tongue
addons.text: Your tongue becomes long, thin, and forked at the end. Could be a fun party trick.

objects.title: Hidden Wings
objects.text: You grow a pair of leathery red wings that grant you the ability to fly. When not in use, the wings can easily fold and be hidden underneath a cloak or exceptionally baggy clothing.

addons.title: Devil's Descent
addons.text: The crimson red wings are a dead giveaway of your fiendish allegiance, even to the most simple peasant.

objects.title: Tentacles
objects.text: You can produce dozens of tentacles from your body, each of them capable of performing rudimentary functions. You can combine them into two powerful tentacles that can act as additional limbs capable of lifting up to 500 pounds each.

addons.title: Styx Serpent Skin
addons.text: When not active, your body takes on a more rubbery, glistening texture. At a glance it could be mistaken for oily skin, but on touch it'll be clear there's something strange.

objects.title: I Am Many
objects.text: Slivers of your mind and being are split from you, allowing you to effortlessly be in many places at once. You can produce miniature versions of yourself that act similarly to familiars. You can see and speak through them.

addons.title: A Piece of Myself
addons.text: When a sliver of yourself is destroyed, it leaves behind a trace amount of your flesh and hair.

objects.title: Power Unleashed
objects.text: For a short duration, you are able to fully embody your fiendish power - transforming into a devil proper. When the transformation ends, you will be significantly weakened.

addons.title: Infernal Beacon
addons.text: Your initial transformation will unleash a burst of fiendish energy that will not go unnoticed by the forces of good. Expect trouble to follow.

rows.title: Infernal Armaments - General
rows.titleText: Infernal Armaments are specialized equipment obtained by our company from across the planes for use during contracts. You will be able to switch out your armaments between each contract, so you should choose the right tools for the task. The following general armaments have a wide range of applicable use that any contractor will find useful to some degree on just about any contract.

objects.title: Phoenixquill Ring
objects.text: A ring made of a preserved phoenix feather that can be summoned with a snap. The feather is a perfect quill for writing and it can also be used to revive fallen allies. Impressive if you ever need to sign a contract, or if a fellow contractor goes down on the job.

objects.title: Dragonstone Ring
objects.text: A ring imbued with the power of an ash dragon, shielding its wearer with ancient wards that make you highly resilient to magical effects, granting you the ability to shrug off debilitating effects when you need it most.

objects.title: The Unholy Grail
objects.text: Allegedly a gift to our president from Asmodeus himself. A sip from this grail before your contract imbues you with unholy power - making you better at literally everything and fiendishly sexy. Recommended for any contractors who want to hedge their bets.

objects.title: Potion Fish
objects.text: A potion bottle with a potion fish. A potion fish magically replicants the liquid its placed. After drinking most of the potion's content, it will refill itself after sometime (depending on how complex the potion is). You can fill it with one of the many potent potions we have in stock such as a Potion of Supreme Healing or a Potion of Fire Giant Strength.

objects.title: Bottomless Coin Purse
objects.text: A leather coin purse connected to a company gold reserve. You can retrieve a near infinite amount of gold from it - as fast as you can fish out coins.

objects.title: Bag Of Holding
objects.text: The famous bag that's bigger on the inside, capable of holding a massive amount of material while staying easily portable.

objects.title: Stardust Cloak
objects.text: A near weightless cloak that goes from a silky smooth hood to an almost mist-like cape, allowing you to move stealthily and in a pinch - teleport with a friend, though after doing so the cloak loses its power until recharged under starlight.

objects.title: Vial of Blue
objects.text: A vial of blue liquid made by Executive Fnipper. Throw it at a problem to solve it.

objects.title: Maleficent Boots
objects.text: You can never go wrong with a good pair of boots. Made in the depths of hell, the quality of the Malificent brand from Maladomini can't be beat. Effortlessly grips to any surface, wall, or even ceiling - allowing easy traversal no matter what hellish terrain you find yourself in. In an emergency, they can even be used to trend across magma!

objects.title: Marble of Force
objects.text: At a glance, a single once use marble that traps a creature in an orb of force magic might seem very niche - but you'll find a good use for such a thing in just about any situation.

objects.title: The Scroll You Need
objects.text: A magical scroll that reads the mind of whoever holds it, displaying whatever content they're expect to see on it. Since it's content is generated from the mind of its holder - it can only show them what they already know.

objects.title: Scarlet Wax
objects.text: A liquid-like candle that burns without smoke - a delicacy to the fiends of the Nine Hells. When out in the field, you can burn its wick to summon imps to you who'll gladly do your bidding in exchange for a bit of the wax. While not the greatest in combat, imps with their natural flight and invisibility are perfect for many sly tasks.

rows.title: Infernal Armaments - Specialty
rows.titleText: Specialty Infernal Armaments are even more specialized and niche. They tend to be highly technical and require either specific situations to be present or made to be of use. Due to the difficulty in their usage, it is only recommended for experienced contractors.

objects.title: Space Traveler's Ring
objects.text: A ring gleaming with a thousand distant stars. With the finger wearing this ring, you can draw circles on flat surfaces to create temporary portals to the last portal you drew.

objects.title: Cigar of Power
objects.text: A thick cigar rolled up with dusty tobacco, old school moxie, and a ranger's luck. While smoking it, you are better at using ranged weapons, tying ropes, and equestrian related activities. If you flick the cigar onto the ground, it will explode.

objects.title: Tracking Stamp
objects.text: The magical stamp of Archmage Idolian. Creatures and objects you stamp are marked with a glowing sigil visible only to you, leaving behind a trail that you can easily track and follow. The sigil lasts for 24 hours.

objects.title: Hidden Wingsuit
objects.text: Made by Executive Fnipper, an otherwise well made but mundane armor that'll always fit you perfectly, the suit has hidden wings that can activate on command to allow you to hover and maneuver in the air. It does not provide lift, so you'll have to gain altitude another way - such as jumping from a high place.

objects.title: Pond in a Bottle
objects.text:
A bottle of water, nothing too spectacular. However, if the bottle is uncorked or shattered, it will rapidly expand into enough water to fill a large pond.

Do not open in an enclosed area.

objects.title: Nature's Vengence
objects.text: A scroll containing the last hateful curses of an old druid. Reading the scroll summons a vengeful spirit that will immediately wreck havoc on its surroundings. It is powerful. It is not friendly.

objects.title: Whimsy's Edge
objects.text:
Pure wild magic concentrated into a whimsical dagger, causing surges to occur very often.

It will sometimes make requests of you, fulfilling them grants you some semblance of control over the surges while ignoring it will make it even more unpredictable.

objects.title: Slayer's Stilettos
objects.text: The final word in high fashion from the Diva Nebula. These heels not only make you look absolutely fabulous. They are also enchanted with a single use (per heel) kick capable of sending a minotaur flying.

objects.title: Flumpbrella
objects.text: A living psionic umbrella monster. While you hold this umbrella, not only are you protected from mild precipitation but also the perception of others. As long as you're not directly interacting with them, you and one other creature under the flumpbrella barely exist to others.

objects.title: Liber Abberatus
objects.text: A tome of change itself, capable of transforming its wielder in strange ways. By incanting the spells it contains, you can turn your greatest weakness into your greatest strength - at the cost of a little sanity.

objects.title: Artificer's Goggles
objects.text: A creation of our Executive Fnipper, overlaying any device you scan - arcane or mundane, with simple instructions on its function and usage.

objects.title: Playback Stopwatch
objects.text: Favored tool of Executive Rivers, clicking the switch on the stopwatch begins a one minute countdown. When the countdown finishes or when you manually click the switch again, you teleport back to where you first clicked the switch.

rows.title: Infernal Armaments - Combat
rows.titleText: Combat Infernal Armaments have the sole purpose of eliminating hostile entities to company assets. It is recommended to bring at least one of the following on most contracts unless you are confident your natural abilities or Diabolic Boons are sufficient to resolve situations that turn violent - as many contracts often have the risk or guarantee of.

objects.title: Eviscerator
objects.text: In thunderous cacophony, this blade of demon slayers declares destruction. A powerful weapon that does significantly more damage with each repeated attack against the same foe - made to cut down titans.

objects.title: Cerberus
objects.text: Hell's premium infernal firearm, a deadly weapon and a symbol of status among fiendish nobility. Capable of unleashing precise rays of fire on single targets or bursts of magma slag against hordes.

objects.title: Dying Grasp
objects.text: An infernal gauntlet infused with the final fury of souls whose lives ended prematurely - much like yours. The closer you are to death, the more power you can draw from this gauntlet to infuse either fist or blade with murderous wrath.

objects.title: Amaki-Tsunami
objects.text: A legendary katana of the Dragon Empire imbued with the force of nature itself. The longer the blade remains sheathed - the more powerful the drawing attack becomes.

objects.title: Reaper-5
objects.text: A collector's item - fifth in the series of the Reaper himself. In the hands of a true reaper, it is capable of severing soul from body. However, in anyone's hands, it is capable of producing tremendous volcanic heat that can also propel you forth with trails of flame.

objects.title: Reaper-9
objects.text: A collector's item - ninth in the series of the Reaper himself. In the hands of a true reaper, it is capable of severing soul from body. However, in anyone's hands, it is capable of distorting gravity, pulling creatures in towards your waiting blade or sending them flying with each swing.

objects.title: Amulet of Annihilation
objects.text: A dangerous artifact that builds up power when the wearer is in battle, discharging it in powerful bursts with each attack. Wielder beware - built up power must be discharged one way or another!

objects.title: Progenitor's Blood
objects.text: A droplet of the Vampire God's Blood. Fluid yet nigh indestructible, this horrific weapon exsanguinates its victims to imbue its wielder with unholy vigor.

objects.title: Guardian Bombard
objects.text: A shield of infernal iron with one of Executive Stonerose's own mastercraft bombards built-in. On top of protecting its wielder from all manner of attacks, it is capable of unleashing a castle toppling blast in battle - though it takes awhile to recharge afterwards.

objects.title: Death's Visage
objects.text: The iron crown once worn by history's greatest forgotten necromancer. With the power that lingers within it, you are able to call upon powerful undead to serve as your swords and shields. This crown's powers are enhanced if you possess natural arcane abilities.

objects.title: Cancer
objects.text: Gauntlets made from the shell of the First Crab. Your mighty grip is both painful and undeniable, your ability to throw knives, boulders, and other creatures across vast distances accurately becomes unmatched.

objects.title: Deathscalibur
objects.text: Sealed for 9999 years in the depths of the 9th layer of hell. This is the most powerful weapon forever capable of killing gods, space, time, and the concept of friendship - according to the sword itself.

objects.title: Witch-Queen's Scourge
objects.text: A whip of crystalized hatred made from the betrayal of the Witch-Queen's demon son. Those who succumb to its lashes' sting bloat with volatile magics before exploding in ichor and gore.

objects.title: Night and Ruin
objects.text: A pair of darts that heralds the end. After being thrown, they will always find their way back to their master. If both pierce the same creature, it causes them to rot from within. If they pierce different creatures, their wounds become shared.

objects.title: Titanmaker
objects.text: The greatest creation of Archmage Idolian which sealed and erased a titan of myth within this collar. To wear it is to wield the awesome might of those who carved the canyons and drank of the seas - though even the mightiest of mortals can only wield a fraction of the power within. [Only barbarians can withstand the might this collar grants]

objects.title: Zan-Karak-Maraz
objects.text: The masterpiece of seven dwarven kings, imbued with their most potent runes of power. When fully empowered, this crimson warhammer can split mountains. [This hammer will only allow itself to be wielded by a dwarf]

objects.title: Fall of Nations
objects.text: The spellbook of Kerillian Telemane, legendary mage of Myth Telemar. Every conceivable destructive spell from the humble Fireball to Power Word Kill is recorded within. A wizard who wields this tome has every combat spell prepared - always. [Only a wizard can benefit from this tome of knowledge]

objects.title: The Concept of Rock
objects.text: It's called a guitar - but a lute is close enough. This is a musical instrument that will one day be wielded by the Iron Bard to found a new wave of bardic magic. For now, it serves to amplify spells that are naturally loud to truly ludicrous levels. [Only bards may wield the "axe" of the founder]

rows.title: Sub-Contracts
rows.titleText: What? Don't feel prepared enough? If you're looking for a little extra, there are some additional stipulations we can add to your contract - you will of course, be compensated accordingly. You can only take on at most two sub-contracts, and do be aware that some of them are permanent.

objects.title: The Muscle
objects.text: Violence solves everything. In some of our contractor groups, we end up with too many schemers and thinkers and not enough doers. When such is the case, we offer a little encouragement to expedite contract completion. [You gain +1 Infernal Armament] [You can only select Combat Infernal Armaments]

objects.title: Wild Card
objects.text: Oh you'll have just the tools for the job alright. The company finds that one advantage we hold over other infernal firms is that we are not bound by the strictly lawful nature of devils. To ensure our contractors bring an aspect of that unpredictable chaos into the field, we offer an incentive to contractors willing to make the wild and weird work. [You gain +1 Infernal Armament] [You can only select Specialty Infernal Armaments]

objects.title: Field Tester
objects.text: Of course it's not safe, that's why it's a test. There are some armaments that naturally see less use than others. Executive Fnipper would like to ensure all our offerings have proper data collected, and is willing to provide you with additional armaments - if you leave their selection up to us. [You gain +1 Infernal Armament] [The company will select all your Infernal Armaments for each task]

objects.title: Sponsorship
objects.text: By the Nine Hells, the Burning Ring, and the Sisters of Fate - I could not live or die without ... The armaments we offer our contractors for the most part are all screened to be useful and powerful in your duties. However, we do have suppliers willing to pay quite well for us to utilize their latest products - and perhaps it'll be of use to you? [You gain a questionable Infernal Armament that you must bring]

objects.title: Viewer's Discretion
objects.text: -and remember to subscribe! Usually we are quiet about our dealings, trade secrets and all that. However, we do advertise our services to select clientele, and if you're not scrying-shy, we can offer you some kick back for putting on a smile for our viewers. [You gain +1 Infernal Armament] [You must say certain phrases to the scrying orb when directed to] [You must not swear for the duration of this contract, each violating will result in incrementally more painful punishments]

objects.title: Mortal, Nothing More
objects.text: Mere mortals have achieved more than any immortal ever have. Holding onto your humanity are you? Admirable. Executive Rivers finds your type amusing, and will provide you a little extra help for however long you stay on this foolish path. [You gain +1 Infernal Armament] [You cannot take any Diabolic Boons]

objects.title: Path of the Sword
objects.text: The noblest of weapons. Among our valuable patrons, one particular master swordsman wishes for the art of swordsmanship to be carried on. If a blade is the only weapon you carry into battle - this one will subsidize you. [You gain +1 Infernal Armament] [You must select a sword combat armament] [You cannot select a non-sword combat armament]

objects.title: Reaper's Apprentice
objects.text: Mad? WHat mAKES YOu thinK I'M MAD? The collection of the Reaper's arsenal we have at the company are (mostly) safe for our contractors due to their soul ripping magics being sealed away. However, our company is all for going above and beyond. If you would request it, we can unseal that power and see how deep the Reaper's madness takes. [Your Reaper scythes' true powers are revealed] [You must select a scythe combat armament] [You cannot select a non-scythe combat armament]

objects.title: Requisitioned Armaments
objects.text: Logistics is the backbone of any company. This sub-contract is permanent. If you prefer to rely on your "natural" abilities, we can requisition your allocated armaments in exchange for additional fiendish power. Don't regret it! [You gain +1 Diabolic Boon] [You lose 1 Infernal Armament]

objects.title: Unseen Dread
objects.text: Leave no trace but subtle horror at what hath transpired. This sub-contract is permanent. Executive Missy has always advocated for subtlety, and for those willing to commit to their requirements for the full duration of their contracts - Missy will grant you a bonus to your fiendish power allowance. [You gain +1 Diabolic Boon] [Your Diabolic Boons cannot be used in the presence of third parties not related to the contract]

objects.title: Lich Queen's Protégé
objects.text: All shall die, all shall serve. This sub-contract is permanent. Among our valuable patrons, one particular mistress of undeath wishes for us to raise her a protégé. If this is a career path you find enticing, her unholiness is ready to invest in you. [You gain +1 Diabolic Boon] [You must always select the Death's Visage armament] [Upon completion of 7 contracts, you will only have one option available to you]

objects.title: Pale Coven
objects.text: We thought them angels - but the ruin they caused was beyond any devil. This sub-contract is permanent. The Pale Coven are a sister organization of ours who specializes in a more subtle approach in their dealings. A rumor and a gesture can ruin a household as effectively as any army or spell. The pale sisters are always interested in those who show promise to join their ranks - and should you swear yourself to them upon contract completion, they have more than enough fiendish power to spare. [You must have the Dark Worship and Devilish Tongue boons] [You gain +1 Diabolic Boon] [Upon completion of 7 contracts, you will only have one option available to you]

objects.title: Order of Desolation
objects.text: The Fallen, The Forsaken, Hell's Ironbound Angels - the Order of Desolation advances the cause of hell across all the planes. This sub-contract is permanent. Many among the ranks of the Desolate - those sworn to hell, are former employees of the company, and this is a path available to you as well. The order will provide you with additional armaments during the period of your contract - in exchange for your service upon your contracts' completion. [You gain +1 Infernal Armament] [Upon completion of 7 contracts, you will only have one option available to you]

objects.title: Repentance
objects.text: This is but a trial. This sub-contract is permanent What's that? You don't need these fiendish gifts? Temptations? What are you on about? Look, the tasks you'll be sent on aren't going to be easy - you really don't need to give yourself a handicap like this. [You lose 1 Diabolic Boon] [You lose 1 Infernal Armament] [You gain ???]

objects.title: Contract-to-Hire
objects.text: Signed in blood, as it was in the days of old. This sub-contract is permanent. Your contract with the company will be extended ahead of time. We are always looking for promising contractors who are able to complete their seven to join us as permanent employees! We are excited to offer you the opportunity to sign on for your continued employment immediately with a sizable sign on bonus. [You gain +1 Diabolic Boon] [Upon completion of 7 contracts, you will only have one option available to you]

rows.title: Finalize
rows.titleText: We're almost done here, if you did everything right the button below should be available.\nIf not, check to make sure you've not gone over your limit on Diabolic Boons or Infernal Armaments.

objects.title: Perfect!
objects.text: Now pay attention, because this is a little finicky. If you take a look at the bottom right of this form, you'll see a little checkmark that will open a summary of all your selections that you can download to share. However, before you do that, make sure you SCROLL TO THE TOP OF THIS PAGE! I don't know why - but if you don't do that, the image you download will be blank. That's all! Good luck with your first contract!

defaultRowText: This is a row, and inside of it, you can place choices. On both rows and choices Requirements can be placed, which will block a row from being viewed, or make the player unable to select a choice, depending on either Point-types or the Ids of other choices. Point-types can be made in Features then Manage Points. Hovering over buttons will explain what they do. The Design of the project can be changed in 'Modify Design' at the side navigation bar, and private styling for each row can be turned on in the rows Settings. Default text like this can be turned off in Features -> Manage Defaults.
defaultChoiceText: This is a Choice, and inside of it, you can place images and text. Scores can be added to it, and have Point-types attached. Addons can be added underneath the image and text. In the Functions at the bottom of the choice, there is an array of different things that can be done. Default text like this can be turned off in Features then Manage Defaults.
defaultAddonText: Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged. It was popularised in the 1960s with the release of Letraset sheets containing Lorem Ipsum passages, and more recently with desktop publishing software like Aldus PageMaker including versions of Lorem Ipsum.
